programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: After finding their car keys hidden within the thick walls of the Castillo de San Marcos in St. Augustine, Florida, the teams scurry to their first golf challenge at the World Golf Hall of Fame.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: It's a race against time and each other, as five teams of two find their way out of an alligator infested Florida swamp to the University of Florida football field for an unexpected chipping challenge.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: The teams face an extraordinary "dogleg" tee shot around the first turn of an Ocala, Florida, horse track.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: The players turn the world's most famous beach into the ultimate "bunker challenge" before rushing to the Orlando Magic practice facility for a full court putting contest.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: Starting their day at the Golf Channel studios in Orlando, Florida, each team gets a shot at hosting a highlight package for the PODS Championship at Innisbrook Resort.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: The teams vie for a set of antique clubs and race to Florida's first golf club for an old school short game challenge.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: Long Drive Champion Brian Pavlet helps tee things off at the Bobby Jones Golf Club in Sarasota, Florida.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: Each team must earn an airboat ride to their vehicle before racing to the Mar-a-Lago Club in West Palm.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: The action begins with a "Clubhouse Challenge" from Doral Golf Resort in Miami, Florida.

programme.title: Highway 18
programme.desc: From Mallory Square to the renowned Key West party spot, Sloppy Joes, the action culminates on the southernmost golf course in America.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick talks about the underlying principle of distance -- clubhead speed -- and the keys to gaining more distance with the driver. McCormick also explains and demonstrates range of motion and speed development.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick, the 2015 PGA Teacher of the Year and coach to three-time major champion Jordan Spieth, unlocks the secrets to building a championship-caliber golf game.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick brings you inside his lab to scientifically prove how ground forces affect the golf swing. McCormick explains how to achieve maximum power with the lead leg and how to move properly through the swing with the trail leg.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: Cameron McCormick brings you inside his lab to scientifically prove how ground forces affect the golf swing. McCormick explains how to achieve maximum power with the lead leg and how to move properly through the swing with the trail leg.

programme.title: The Skill Code
programme.desc: The most common problem for amateur golfers is the slice. Cameron McCormick, the 2015 PGA Teacher of the Year, tackles this issue by explaining how club delivery with the face and path dictates curve.
